column1: #Text=Chavakkad is a municipality in Thrissur District of Kerala state in India .
#Text=Chavakkad is noted for its beach and fishing . [ 1 ]

#Text=It lies on National Highway 17 is located about 75 km ( 47 mi ) north of the city of Kochi , the commercial capital of Kerala and 25 km ( 16 mi ) west of Thrissur , the cultural capital of Kerala .
#Text=In spite of being a small fishing village , Chavakkad is an extremely rich place .
#Text=You will be surprised by the sheer number of luxury villas in this village .
#Text=The people make their money by working in the gulf countries and as per the local grapewine , from smuggling and such illegal business activities .
#Text=The locals will introduce themselves as smugglers because it is a respectable profession in two cities of Kerala : Chavakkad and Kasaragod .
#Text=The Chavakkad Province , which was under the control of the Punnathur Swarupam , was captured by the Dutch in 1717 and the Mysore force in 1776 .
#Text=In 1789 , on the 26th of September , Chavakkad came to be under the British Malabar used to be a district in the Madras Province .
#Text=It had then for its Province self rule certain Unions
#Text=The history of the local self-government of chavakkad commences with the formation of the chavakkad union in 1918 under the Malabar District Board .
#Text=In 1927 , a new administrative machinery formed the Panchayat Board was introduced .
#Text=In those day only the big landlords , who paid regular taxes had the right to candidature in the elections and the right to vote as well .
#Text=The elections were not conducted on the basis of secret ballots then .
#Text=Such a system was started only in 1953 , six years after the attainment of independence , during the Panchayat elections .

#Text=Prior to the Panchayat elections of 1963 , the first ever such election after formation of the Kerala State in 1956 , the Chavakkad Panchayat had to be re-partitioned in the course of which the Guruvayoor Province was separated from the Chavakkad Panchayat and certain other provinces like the southern Palayoor , Punna , Thiruvathra , Blangad and Manathala included .
#Text=On October 1 st 1978 , Chavakkad Panchayat was upgraded to the status of a Municipality .
#Text=Located on the coast of Arabian Sea in West Coast , Chavakkad Beach is counted amongst Kerala 's most popular beaches .
#Text=It is two kilometres from the Chavakkad town .
#Text=Chavakkad Beach is famous for the spectacle called ' Azhimokam ' in Malayalam which means a place where a river confluences with the sea .
#Text=Located at Thottappu 6 Km From Chavakkad Town .
#Text=Breath Taking View Of Kerala and Arabian Sea .
#Text=We can see western ghats from here on clear day .
#Text=Located at Palayur , the church was established in 52 AD by St Thomas , one of the twelve close disciples of Jesus Christ . [ 14 ]

#Text=Palayoor church is the oldest ( Romo-Syrian ) Church in India and is called an Apostolic Church credited to the Apostolate of St. Thomas who preached and also started conversion of people to Christianity here .
#Text=, 22/521A , Enamavu Road ( Enamavu road , opposite Mughal Jewelry ) , ☏ +914872507027 . 9AM-9PM .
#Text=Popular for Rottippathiri , a kind of rice cake that goes well with meat .
#Text=Smuggling and other illegal activities are quite rife in Chavakkad and there is a big and established underworld .
#Text=Take care of speeding vehicles and suspicious looking persons coming near your luggage .
#Text=You need not carry this fear complex with you everywhere in Kerala , as there is only one more place in Kerala where smuggling is widespread , that is Kasaragod in the north .
